article:
This story is about a 92-year-old, polite and proud lady. She is fully   _  each morning by eight, with her hair fashionably done and make-up  _  applied, even though she is old and weak. She is moving to a nursing
home today. Her husband of 70 years old recently  passed away  , making the move necessary.
After many hours of waiting   _  in the hall of the nursing house, she smiled sweetly when  _  her room was ready. As she directed her walker to the elevator, I
provided a visual  _  of her tiny
room, including the eyelet  sheets that had been hung on her window. "I   _  it," she stated with the enthusiasm of an eight-year-old girl who had
just been  _  with a new puppy.
"Mrs. Jones, you haven't seen the   _  yet. Just wait."
"That has nothing to do with it," she replied. "  _  is something you decide
on ahead of time. Whether I like my room or not does not  depend on  how the furniture is arranged; it is how I make up my  _  . I've already decided to love it. It's a decision I make every morning
when I  wake up  .
"I have a   _  : I can spend the day in bed recounting the difficulties I have with the
parts of my body that no longer work, or get out of bed and be  _  for the ones that do. Each day is a  _  , and as long as my eyes open I will focus on the new day and all the happy  _  I've stored away....just for this
time in my life.
"Age is like a bank account. You withdraw   _  what you have put
in. Therefore, my advice to you would be to  _  a lot of happiness in the bank account of memories. Thank you for
your part in  _  my memory bank, I am
still depositing.
